verses.plain: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

tokens.t: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

verses.plain: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:

tokens.t: Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:

verses.plain: Who whet their tongue like a sword, and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words:

tokens.t: Who whet their tongue like a sword,

verses.plain: That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.

tokens.t: That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.

verses.plain: They encourage themselves in an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who shall see them?

tokens.t: an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who shall see them?

verses.plain: They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward thought of every one of them, and the heart, is deep.

tokens.t: They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward

verses.plain: But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.

tokens.t: But God shall shoot at them
an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.

verses.plain: So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.

tokens.t: So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.

verses.plain: And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.

tokens.t: And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.

verses.plain: The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.

tokens.t: The righteous shall be glad in the
, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.

footnotes.text: of…: Heb. to hide his snares
they…: or, we are consumed by that which they have throughly searched
a diligent…: Heb. a search searched
shall they…: Heb. their wound shall be
